plantit.collection package¶

The collections module contains information and logic related to the data users want to analyze using a Plant IT workflow.

Definitions:
sample: The individual unit fed into a Plant IT workflow. What is

contained in a sample is dependent on the workflow that will analyze the sample. For example, a sample may be an individual image, a folder containing slices from 3D imaging, or a csv file contining points for a cloud map.

Plant IT makes no assumptions about what a sample is. Sample format is defined by the workflow that will analyze it.

collection: A set of samples related in some way that will be

analyzed by the same workflow.

For example, all the roots collected in an experiment may go into one collection, as they will all be analyzed by the same downstream workflow.

Submodules¶

plantit.collection.models module¶

class plantit.collection.models.Collection(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model, plantit.collection.mixins.CastableModelMixin

Collections are a set of samples hat are analyzed together by the same Plant IT workflow. Typically representing one experiment or treatment.

name¶

the name of the collection

Type

str

description¶

text description and/or notes

Type

str

user¶

primary user for the collection

Type

ForeignKey

storage_type¶

The name of the storage system the samples are saved on. It must be a key in file_manager.filesystems.Registrar.list

Type

string

base_file_path¶

Sample paths are relative to this path on the file system.

Type

str

metadata¶

Metadata for the collection.

Type

JSONField

add_sample(name, path, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a new Sample and add it to this collection. generate_thumbnail() is automatically called when the sample is added.

Parameters

  • name (string) – Name of the sample

  • path (string) – Path to the sample. Relative to the collection’s base_file_path and storage_type.

to_json()[source]¶

Create a json representation of the collection

returns (String): json string

class plantit.collection.models.Sample(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Represents one experimental sample. I.E. The unit of information that is analyzed by the workflow.

Sample objects only contain a link to the path to the files within the sample. plantit.file_manager is used to access the files.

collection¶

the collection this sample belongs to

Type

Collection

path¶

the path to the file relative to collection’s base file path.

Type

String

name¶

the name of the sample

Type

String

thumbnail_supported¶

Thumbnails are supported for this sample type. This is set to false by generate_thumbnail() if the sample format is not supported by generate_thumbnail

Type

bool

thumbnail¶

url to the thumbnail. See django-imagekit for details on saving a new thumbnail. This is set to null if 1) generate_thumbnail was not called or has not finished running, or 2) thubnail_supported = False

Type

ProcessedImageField

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

get()[source]¶

Get the sample file/folder.

Returns

A file like object containing the sample data.

plantit.collection.models.generate_thumbnail(*a, **kw)[source]¶

Generate the thumbnail image for a sample. This function runs in a celery task and is automatically called by Collection.add_sample() when a sample is added to a collection.

Sample type is automatically detected and the correct thumbnail code is run for the sample type. If the sample format is not supported, Sample.thumbnail_supported is set to false and Sample.thumbnail is left null

If a thumbnail is generated, Sample.thumbnail_supported is set to true and Sample.thumbnail is set to the thumbnail image. See Sample.thumbnail for more information.

Note

Currently only supports creating thumbnails of images (jpeg, jpg, png, tiff).

Parameters

sample_pk (int) – pk of the sample
